posts.post_content:
It took me a while to really grasp the "its name is still Sakashima the Impostor" line... But then my jaw, it dropped!
  
   
I agree with A3Kitsune, basically, all shapeshifters should work like this, after all, in-universe, a shapeshifter looking like Volrath died to Gerrard's blade in the Evincar's place!
  
   
Also, the thought that this lady goes to her wardrobe and pulls a disguise that then makes her into a titanic Elder God monstrosity is highly amusing. :D
posts.html:
It took me a while to really grasp the "its name is still Sakashima the Impostor" line... But then my jaw, it dropped!

I agree with A3Kitsune, basically, all shapeshifters should work like this, after all, in-universe, a shapeshifter looking like Volrath died to Gerrard's blade in the Evincar's place!

Also, the thought that this lady goes to her wardrobe and pulls a disguise that then makes her into a titanic Elder God monstrosity is highly amusing. :D

posts.post_content:
Yes, you can copy a Legendary creature and they remain in the battlefield! It's a reusable Clone, but it's Legendary so you can't have more than one in the battlefield.   
Clone:   
-easier casting cost  
-kills Legends  
  
Sakashima:  
-doesn't kill Legends  
-reusable  
-At its worst is a 3/1 for ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)  
-It's Legendary  
  
5/5
posts.html:
Yes, you can copy a Legendary creature and they remain in the battlefield! It's a reusable Clone, but it's Legendary so you can't have more than one in the battlefield.
Clone:
-easier casting cost
-kills Legends

Sakashima:
-doesn't kill Legends
-reusable
-At its worst is a 3/1 for
-It's Legendary

5/5

Posted By: Trygon_Predator (5/31/2012 8:22:58 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@DavidLopes - yes, you can copy a creature-fied planeswalker. But Sakashima also copies the planeswalker's subtype (on your example, it would be "Planeswalker - Tezzeret"), so both Sakashima and original Tezzeret will go to the graveyard before you have the chance to use any of Sakashima's walker abilities.
  
   
Sakashima ignores the legend rule because it keeps its own name, but the planeswalkers rule looks at the subtype.
posts.html:
@DavidLopes - yes, you can copy a creature-fied planeswalker. But Sakashima also copies the planeswalker's subtype (on your example, it would be "Planeswalker - Tezzeret"), so both Sakashima and original Tezzeret will go to the graveyard before you have the chance to use any of Sakashima's walker abilities.

Sakashima ignores the legend rule because it keeps its own name, but the planeswalkers rule looks at the subtype.

posts.post_content:
What if I grab this guy and make him copy a planeswalker while he's being considered a creature? Let's say I go through the trouble of dropping a [Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas) and [Liquimetal Coating](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liquimetal Coating) then use his -1 on himself and finally drop Sakashima and make him copy Tezzeret.  
Will he have his Planeswalker abilities? Because if so, holy cow double planeswalker fun.

posts.post_content:
(While having either [Leyline of Anticipation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leyline of Anticipation) or [Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir) in play,) I was thinking about copying [Gideon Jura](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gideon Jura) with this... but then thought, does **Sakashima** remain as a creature at the end of the turn?...  
  
If that's case, then the problem lies in the fact that perhaps at the end of the turn Sakashima refrains from being 6/6 and becomes 0/0 at the end of the turn and one would need a continual booster like [glorious anthem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=glorious anthem)/[gaea's anthem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=gaea's anthem) (or even [honor of the pure](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=honor of the pure) would work here seeing as Sakasima would become white).  
  
jk! you can't have two planeswalkers with the same type! gotcha! [haha](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=74293)
